channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Extreme Weather Is Hitting Americans in the Wallet
item.description: Cities and counties are selling bonds to cover costs from storms and drought.

item.title: We ranked the latest earnings reports from 30 portfolio stocks from great to ugly
item.description: Our companies' performances were reflective of the S&P 500 firms in aggregate.

item.title: How Hello Kitty Took Over the World
item.description: Investors in Sanrio have made 10 times their money as the iconic Japanese brand expands digitally.

item.title: China Market Support May Fizzle Out If Key Issues Remain Unsolved
item.description: China’s push to bolster its stock markets has stirred optimism, but begs the question of whether investors will take the bait amid lingering doubts ab...

item.title: H&M shares fall as much as 8% on profit miss and scrapped earnings margin target
item.description: Shares of H&M tumbled as much as 8% on Thursday after the world's second-largest listed fashion retailer posted a miss on operating profit.

item.title: Adobe stock slips on soft fourth-quarter revenue guidance
item.description: Adobe reported third-quarter results on Thursday that beat Wall Street expectations for sales and earnings.

item.title: When Will Money-Market Funds Lose Their Allure?
item.description: Cash has been one of the hottest investments since 2020. Now, some investors are weighing when to get out.

item.title: Oracle bumps up fiscal 2026 revenue forecast, lifting stock 6%
item.description: Oracle is projecting higher revenue and capital expenditures as its cloud-computing arm grows.

item.title: Darden Restaurants earnings disappoint as Olive Garden, fine dining sales struggle
item.description: Olive Garden parent Darden Restaurants reported weaker-than-expected earnings and revenue for its fiscal first quarter.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg's AI Vision Makes Metaverse a Slightly Easier Sell
item.description: Meta’s latest AI tools and headsets could prove to be an edge in consumer adoption and keep investors on board with massive spending.
